function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Lack of natural ventilation in bedrooms","Impact":"Poor ventilation can lead to the accumulation of airborne contaminants and the spread of contagious diseases, impacting resident health.","Mitigation":"Install operable windows in bedrooms to promote natural ventilation and reduce the risk of airborne disease transmission. Implement regular cleaning and maintenance of ventilation systems.","Technologies":"Smart ventilation systems with air purification capabilities can help maintain indoor air quality and reduce the risk of airborne disease transmission.","People":"Residents, especially those living in high-density housing such as apartment buildings, are at risk.","Owner":"Building management, government health agencies, and residents can implement ventilation improvements."},{"Description":"Limited access to restorative spaces","Impact":"Lack of access to restorative spaces can lead to increased stress, mental health issues, and disrupted sleeping patterns among residents.","Mitigation":"Create and maintain nonbedroom spaces within buildings that promote relaxation, physical activity, and social interactions. Design outdoor areas and shared common spaces to support restorative experiences and positive social interactions.","Technologies":"Biophilic design elements, green spaces, and natural lighting can be incorporated into building design to enhance the restorative capabilities of shared spaces.","People":"Residents in apartment buildings are at risk of experiencing limited access to restorative spaces.","Owner":"Building developers, architects, and building management can work to create and maintain restorative spaces within residential buildings."},{"Description":"Inadequate thermal comfort in living spaces","Impact":"Poor thermal comfort conditions, including overcooling in the summer and overheating in the winter, can lead to discomfort, reduced productivity, and increased health issues among residents, especially vulnerable populations.","Mitigation":"Ensure proper insulation, air sealing, and efficient heating, ventilation, and air conditioning (HVAC) systems to maintain thermal comfort in living spaces. Retrofit underperforming housing to address thermal discomfort and improve indoor environmental quality.","Technologies":"Energy-efficient HVAC systems, smart thermostats, and building insulation technologies can help maintain consistent thermal comfort and reduce energy consumption.","People":"Residents living in apartment housing, particularly vulnerable populations, are at risk of experiencing inadequate thermal comfort.","Owner":"Building management, government housing authorities, and housing advocacy groups can take action to address inadequate thermal comfort and retrofit underperforming housing."}]}
